intro: Haplophyllum tuberculatum var. leiocalycinum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved haplophyllum, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
